news.title: Martha Nolan-O’Slat­arra’s family ‘stunned’ by claims made to US detectives that she was battling brain cancer before death
news.summary: Claims that an Irish woman found dead on a yacht in the US had been battling brain cancer are being investigated by detectives probing her death.

news.title: From Israel to his mother’s tears and a vow to ‘Make Ireland home again’ – here’s what we learnt from Gareth Sheridan’s presidential campaign launch
news.summary: Businessman and entrepreneur Gareth Sheridan has officially launched his bid to be president of Ireland. Here is what we learnt about the 35-year-old Dublin man, who is running as an Independent candidate.

news.title: ‘Like starting all over again’ – Fine Gael scrambles to regroup after shock departure of Mairead McGuinness from presidential race
news.summary: Fine Gael is re-examining its approach to the presidential contest following the shock withdrawal of party candidate Mairead McGuinness on health grounds.

news.title: ‘My mom is really proud. And obviously it’s a shame that my granddad’s not here to witness it, but she’s really proud’
news.summary: Ellena Perry pulls out her phone from inside her pocket to check the exact date she got the WhatsApp message that changed not just the course of her summer but her international career.

news.title: Man dies following Kerry road crash
news.summary: A man has died following a road crash on the N69 road between Tarbert and Listowel that occurred at approximately 10am on Friday.

news.title: Young renter ‘forced to throw out clothes and is suffering recurring chest infections’ due to mould issues
news.summary: A young woman renting an apartment has claimed severe issues with mould have affected her health, destroyed some of her clothing and are causing a “constant damp smell”.

news.title: 'They were being fully intimate on the train at 11 o’clock in the morning': Irish passengers share their public transport horror stories
news.summary: Love it or hate it, public transport is a core part of most of our lives. August is a busy time of year for planes, trains and buses with so many of us heading off on holiday at home or abroad, and public transport is sure to be under pressure.

news.title: Temperatures could hit highs of 27C this weekend as humid nights ahead
news.summary: Temperatures could hit highs of 26C degrees today as Met Éireann forecasts dry, warm weather with spells of sunshine.

news.title: Reviews on the road: Lucinda O’Sullivan finds the best restaurants, hotels, seafood and sights in Cork and Kerry
news.summary: Where better to kick off a culinary coastal crusade than Kinsale, the gourmet capital of Ireland, and starting point of the Wild Atlantic Way. When it comes to restaurants, cafes and bars, you’re spoiled for choice at all price levels.

news.title: Modern Morals: My mother-in-law plans to wear an off-white dress to my wedding. How do I tell her I’m not okay with that at all?
